content.title: Coaching Assistance to Scheduled Castes Students for Preparation of Examination Like IIM, NIFT, NLU, CEPT
content.details: The scheme 'Coaching Assistance to Scheduled Castes Students for Preparation of Examination Like IIM, NIFT, NLU, CEPT' was launched by the Director Scheduled Caste Welfare, Department of Social Justice & Empowerment, Government of Gujarat. Under the scheme, financial assistance is provided to Students of the Scheduled Castes category who are preparing for examinations like IIM, NIFT, NLU, and CEPT.
benefits: Under this scheme, ₹20,000/- or the actual coaching fee to be paid, whichever is less.
eligibility: The students should belong to Scheduled Caste Category.
A student should have secured 70% or more in Class 10th and studying in Class 12th (any stream) to get admission in CEPT, NIFT, or NLU.

To get admission in IIMs: Students should have secured 70% or more in Class 12th (any stream) and be in the third year of graduation (any stream) or should have secured 70% or more marks in graduation if completed.
The organization should have more than three years of experience.
The organization should have a GST Number/PAN card.
Institutions should have biometric (fingerprint) machines for student attendance.
The training institute should be registered under any one of the following Acts: Mumbai Public Trust Act, 1950; Companies Act, 1956; Shop and Establishment Act, 1948.
content.application_process: Online and Offline. Eligible applicants may visit the e-Samaj Kalyan Portal: https://esamajkalyan.gujarat.gov.in/ and follow the registration and application steps provided.
documents_required: Proof of Residence (Any one of Electricity Bill/Licence/Rent Agreement/Electoral Card/Ration Card)
Certificate (Bonafide) regarding the school he/she is studying in Class-12
Copy of the first page of Bank Passbook / Cancelled Check (in applicant's name)
A photograph showing the board of the institution to which admission is sought
Regular certificate from the institution in which you want to study

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Students belonging to the Scheduled Caste category are eligible to apply.

faqs.question: What are the educational eligibility criteria for students applying under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Students must have secured 70% or more in Class 10th and be studying in Class 12th for CEPT, NIFT, NLU. For IIMs, students should have secured 70% or more in Class 12th and be in the third year of graduation or have secured 70% or more marks in graduation if completed.

faqs.question: Is there any restriction based on the family income of the student?
faqs.answer: No, there is no income limit for eligibility under this scheme.

faqs.question: What are the benefits provided to eligible students?
faqs.answer: Eligible students receive financial assistance of ₹20,000/- or the actual coaching fee, whichever is lower.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for coaching institutes?
faqs.answer: Coaching institutes should have more than three years of experience, possess a GST Number/PAN card, have biometric attendance systems, and be registered under specific Acts like the Mumbai Public Trust Act, Companies Act, or Shop and Establishment Act.

faqs.question: How can students apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligible applicants can apply through the e-Samaj Kalyan Portal at https://esamajkalyan.gujarat.gov.in/.
